main event: A star-like object was sighted moving slowly in a straight line near Dobbins AFB, Georgia on February 9, 1953.
interesting points: The observation lasted for about 2 minutes.,The object was described as having an orange glow and maintaining a straight course.,The object appeared to stand still for a few moments before fading out.,The sighting was conducted by a control tower operator at Dobbins AFB.,The object was ultimately concluded to be Jupiter based on its position and appearance.
sighted object: star-like object with an orange glow
witness description: control tower operator A/1C J C Williamson
